text.innertext: A highly motivated Backend Engineer with a strong foundation in Robotics Engineering and a passion for developing software solutions.

Possessing a solid foundation in engineering principles, analytical thinking, and problem-solving, I am eager to leverage my technical skills and adaptability to contribute to the development and optimization of software applications. With my drive for continuous learning, I am determined to excel in the realm of back-end engineering.
Below is a list of some tools that I can confidently use:
Backend tools:
Python3, Git, Django, Django REST framework, PySimpleGUI, Python-Telegram-Bot library, PostgreSQL, SQLite
Frontend tools:
HTML, CSS, SASS, JavaScript
DevOps skills:
Bash scripting, GitHub Actions, light server maintenance (can also setup a web-server using NGINX and gunicorn)
Other:
Some time ago used to program PLCs using C, FBD and Ladder Diagram
Throughout my illustrious professional trajectory, I have acquired a remarkable array of skills, which encompass the following:

Proficient problem-solving capabilities
Exceptional critical thinking prowess
Extensive cross-disciplinary knowledge
Proficiency in self-directed learning
Passionate pursuit of exploring cutting-edge trends within my industry
These competencies serve as a testament to my dedication and commitment to continuously enhance my expertise, thereby enabling me to thrive in diverse professional contexts.

My latest achievement on the backend-developer path is Chormeisters.com, a website designed to assist musical collectives in organizing their activities. You can now register on the platform, or contact me directly, and I will give you access to the test piece of it.
Chormeister was entirely developed by me using Django framework and SQLite as the underlying technologies. Here's the GitHub repo.

I had built a couple of utilities for myself (like MyPomodoros and ChormeisterBot) and for job-related stuff (like forming all the specifications needed push huge projects in production). Source code for them is available in my GitHub profile. Telegram bots are live and hosted on my private VPS.
